New Records: Michael Massey hit his 14th home run of the season
Key Match Events: Atlanta Braves lost to the playoff-bound Kansas City Royals 4-2
Charlie Morton gave up a three-run homer to Michael Massey in the first inning
Gio Urshela homered for the Braves
Alec Marsh (9-9) allowed one earned run over five innings for the win
Kris Bubic pitched a scoreless ninth for his first save
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves and the Mets are both 88-72, and Arizona finished 89-73
If either team sweeps Monday, the Diamondbacks reach the playoffs
If the doubleheader is split, the Mets and Braves advance and Arizona is out because the Braves and Mets hold the tiebreaker edge over the Diamondbacks
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker said 'This whole thing here has been something that I donâ€™t think anybody has ever experienced'

Matt Olson said 'Schreiber had a funky arm and made some good pitches. It was a different angle and not stuff you see every day. He made some good pitches. I was on second base looking at a lot of them. Sometimes you have to tip the cap.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rookie Spencer Schwellenbach will start the opener of the doubleheader
Chris Sale, the leading NL Cy Young Award contender, is slated for the second game
Bobby Witt went 1 for 4 to earn the AL batting title with a.332 average
The Royals claimed the No. 5 seed in the American League and will face fourth-seeded Baltimore in the Wild Card Series
Others: The doubleheader against the Mets is to make up the games that were postponed on Wednesday and Thursday by heavy rains
